Localization.AdminDbMaintenanceCompactNote: In order to reduce the size of the database file, please click the button below. It is necessary to perform the compression of the database periodically, since, for example, after removal of some inactive public links or old log records the DB file size doesn't decrease.
Localization.AdminDbMaintenanceCompactAutoNote: You can also turn on the automatic compression database after the removal of records operations, however, it is not recommended because it maybe more frequent locks of the base and it can increase the duration of some requests. Attention! After changing of this setting the application will be restarted!
Localization.AdminDbMaintenanceCompactAutoSaveSuccess: The changing of the DB automatic сompression has been completed successfully. The page will be updated shortly.
Localization.AdminDbMaintenanceEnableLogLabel: Select DB queries logging level (into Data/debug.log)
Localization.AdminDbMaintenanceSettingsSaveSuccess: DB settings saved successfully. The page will be reloaded
Localization.AdminDbMaintenanceSettingsChangeNote: Attention! After saving of the settings the application will be restarted shortly!
Localization.AdminDbMaintenanceInsertIntervalLabel: The interval (in minutes) of adding events to the DB. If you specify 0, the insertion will appear directly after the events.
Localization.AdminDbMaintenanceStatTitle: Statistics (depends on DB log level DurationExecution)
Localization.AdminMiscLoadADAccountsInfo: Here you can generate the file containing the whole Active Directory users structure. This file is needed if you use a static file as AD info storage. The same file can be generated via ADManager utility. For more info see ADAccountsFilePath parameter description in {0}Manual{1}.
Localization.AdminMiscManageQuotasInfo: Query existing or create new quota to limit the space allowed for a folder, powered by File Server Resource Manager.
Localization.AdminMiscFoldersFromGPOLInfo: You can load (or update) the folder list from the Group Policy Drive Mapping settings in the Domain Controller. In the field below you can enter the computer name from which Group Policy settings will be loaded (or if left empty, then the current domain will be used), or a path to file with the Mapped Drives settings.
Localization.AdminAnonymFoldersDeleteFolderPrompt: Are you sure you want to remove {0} selected anonymous folders?
Localization.AdminAnonymFoldersDescription:
Shared folders/files - these are folders/files that don't require user authentication*, that means that they are available for all visitors* (if they have a link). All users can create such folders/files from the menu "Share → Create a public link". However, shared folders may have limited permissions: for uploading, downloading, files/folders list. Below is a table of links to shared folders/files created by users. To work public links feature correctly be sure that Handlers\Anonymousdownload.ashx allows anonymous access to IIS. You may check this on the Diagnostics page. Make sure that the anonymous user account assigned to Handlers\Anonymousdownload.ashx has NTFS reading/writing permissions for shared folders/files.
* —  if you do not specify users, for which only is allowed access.
Localization.AdminFoldersDeleteFolderPrompt: Are you sure you want to remove folder "{0}"?
Localization.AdminFoldersFolderNotFound: A folder with this name was not found

Localization.AdminFoldersFolderQuotaHint: Query existing or create new quota to limit the space allowed for a folder, powered by File Server Resource Manager.
Localization.AdminFoldersDescription: You can add folders manually or convert existing folders if you are using drives at Group policies. For more info see {0}Help{1}.
Localization.AdminFoldersPermissionsForRegex: You can also use a regular expression. Please enter {0} at the beginning of the field above and then a regular expression, for example:
Localization.AdminFoldersPermissionsForRegexUsers:
{0} (provide access for any user)
{1} (this regular expression means two users: jdoe and Mike)
Localization.AdminFoldersPermissionsForRegexGroups:
{0} (provide access for any group)
{1} (this regular expression means all groups with "Students" in their names)

Localization.AdminFoldersCreateHint: Allow/Deny actions from menu "New": new file, new folder, new image, new document files.
Localization.AdminFoldersDeleteHint: Allow/Deny deleting of existing files and folders
Localization.AdminFoldersRenameHint: Allow/Deny renaming of existing files and folders
Localization.AdminFoldersUploadHint: Allow/Deny uploading files feature (Upload button at the toolbar)
Localization.AdminFoldersDownloadHint: Allow/Deny "download", "view / edit", download to cloud storages, etc actions

Localization.AdminFoldersUnzipHint: Allow/Deny "Extract to the current folder", "Extract to a new folder" and "Zip contents" actions

Localization.AdminFoldersAnonymUploadHint: Allow/Deny files upload for anonymous users (via public links)
Localization.AdminFoldersWatchHint: Allow/Deny users to monitor the changes in the folder made by other users (it is applied only if UI/AllowUsersmonitorModifications=true)
Localization.AdminFoldersListRestrictionsHint: This option controls file listing. Click "Deny" radio button to hide files with specified extensions. Insert prohibited extensions separating them by comma (e.g. "EXE,BAT,COM"). Set "Allow" radio button and insert extensions of the files that will be shown (e.g. "DOC,PDF,JPG").
Localization.AdminFoldersCreateRestrictionsHint: This function is similar to "List restrictions", but it controls files uploading, zip extraction, creating new files. You can prohibit or enable uploading of specified files.
Localization.AdminFoldersGeneralInfoHint: Type existing folder path and alias. Click Help button at the bottom for more info.
Localization.AdminFoldersUsersGroupsHint: Select or type Users and groups to share folder for them. Click Help button at the bottom for more info.

Localization.AdminUsersCountExceededWarn: Maximum quantity of users is exceeded. Your current license allows only {0} users for login. For more info open "{1}" tab and find "{2}" exception(s). To hide this notification clear log records at "{1}" tab.
Localization.SettingsFormatSet: Comma-separated list without repetitions of values
Localization.SettingsFormatToolbarButtons: . (Value "{0}" can be repeated several times, but not in a row. After each name, followed by a colon, it is possible to specify one of methods used to display the button: {1})
Localization.AdminHintHiddenParams: Additional parameters are intended only for more granular settings and in most cases are seldom necessary
Localization.SettingsDenyAuthModeChange: Automatic authentication mode changeover is not supported. See {0} for instructions about changing the authentication mode.
Localization.SettingsSettingsSaveFailedAppMsg: Unable to save configuration files. Check write NTFS permissions of web.config and HttpCommanderSettings.config files in the web application root folder {0} for user {1}. Error message: {2}.
Localization.SettingsSettingsSaveFailedTempMsg: Unable to save configuration files. Check permissions of the temporary folder {0} for user {1}. Error message: {2}.
Localization.SettingsSettingsReadFailedAppMsg: Unable to read configuration files. Check read NTFS permissions of web.config and HttpCommanderSettings.config files in the web application root folder {0} for user {1}. Error message: {2}.
Localization.SettingsSettingsReadFailedTempMsg: Unable to read configuration files in the temporary folder. Check permissions of the temporary folder {0} for user {1}. Error message: {2}.
Localization.SettingsSettingsConfigChangedOutside: The HttpCommander configuration file has been changed by another program. Possibly you have modified it manually with a text editor. The application has loaded the new configuration file. All changes related to HttpCommander configuration which you've done through the web interface are lost. You need to redo them, then try to save again. We recommend against editing configuration files manually while the application is running. Otherwise you should restart the application after changing configuration files. Error message: {0}.
Localization.SettingsSettingsSaveNotif: Don't forget to save settings changes!
Localization.FsrmUnableLoadLibraryLocal: Unable to connect to File Server Resource Manager on local host.
Localization.FsrmUnableLoadLibraryRemote: Unable to connect to File Server Resource Manager on "{0}" host.
Localization.FsrmNotInstalled: File Server Resource Manager is not installed on "{0}".
Localization.FsrmNotInstalledEitherEnd: File Server Resource Manager is not installed either on local host or on "{0}".
Localization.AdminUpdateBackupContent: Please press the button "{0}" for creation of a backup copy of the folder with the application and getting a link for the downloading
Localization.AdminUpdateDownloadBackupLinkHint: Please download a backup copy of the application using the link below:
Localization.AdminUpdateDownloadNewContent: Then please download a new version using the link below and follow the {0}installation{1} and {2}upgrade{1} instructions in order to install a new version. After the installation please open the Admin Panel, go to the tab "{3}" and press the button "{4}" in order to complete the installation.
Localization.AdminUpdateUploadButton: Upload a backup copy and apply settings
Localization.AdminUpdateUploadAndInstallButton: Install a new version with keeping all settings
Localization.AdminUpdateUploadEmptyText: Please select a backup copy for uploading
Localization.AdminUpdateFinishContent: In order to restore the settings of the previous version please select and upload a previously created backup archive with the application folder
Localization.AdminUpdateFinishMessage: Congratulations! All settings are successfully applied. Also, please apply all changes you made to other files, e.g. Default.aspx or Global.asax.
Localization.AdminUpdateMainInfo: This type of upgrading is partially automated. You may create and download a backup file with the application configuration settings and restore it after the upgrading. Please follow these short steps: create a backup file, perform the manual upgrading, restore the settings from the backup file. This procedure also can be used to backup/restore the settings without upgrading. Simply skip the upgrading step to restore the settings from the backup file.
Localization.AdminUpdateAutoInfo: This type of upgrading is almost fully automated. It consist of 2 steps: backup of the current settings (you should download and save a backup file), installation of a new version and restoration of the settings from the backup file. HTTP Commander can automatically download the latest version and install it or you can specify the path to the zip archive with a new version on our server. All settings are automatically restored from a previously created backup file.
Localization.AdminUpdateRestoreWebConfigCheckBox: Restore the settings from Web.config (e.g., such as SMTP)
Localization.AdminUpdateBackupAssignedFoldersInRootMe: Attention! There are some user folders in the directory with the application that have the total size more than {0}. The backup won't be made. Please do a backup copy of these directories, remove them from the application directory and retry the operation on your side.
Localization.AdminUpdateNeedRefreshPageForContinue: Attention! To continue it is necessary to reload the page. Please press the button "{0}". After reloading please repeat the operation.
Localization.AdminUpdateRestoreFromBackupEmpty: , or if it is not selected, it will be used by the newly created file in the previous step
Localization.AdminUpdateInstallZipPathHint: For updating please specify the full physical path to the installation file (on the server) in the first field or leave it blank in order to use an online distribution
Localization.AdminUpdateInstallZipPathEmpty: Specify path to archive with install
Localization.AdminUpdateAccessDeniedWarning:
Attention! For updating please set the modify (reading and writing) NTFS permissions to {0} user for folder with HTTP Commander{1} and repeat the upgrading.
>After the successful upgrading please restore the former rights.
